title: Turkish FM Hakan Fidan in Islamabad on official visit
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 9 (APP): Foreign Minister of Turkiye Hakan Fidan arrived here late Tuesday night on an official visit to Pakistan.
He was received by Additional Secretary (West Asia) Ambassador Syed Ali Asad Gillani, according to a Foreign Office press release.
During his official engagements in Pakistan, the Turkish foreign minister will discuss all important issues of mutual interest.
Earlier, Turkish Minister of National Defence Yasar Güler also arrived here, who will also discuss key matters of mutual interest with the Pakistani leadership.
The visit of two Turkish ministers reflects the close and brotherly ties between Pakistan and Turkiye, rooted in shared history, culture, and mutual trust.
Ishtiaq Ahmed, APP’s Foreign Editor, leads coverage of the Prime Minister, President and Foreign Office, bringing over 20 years of journalism experience from local and international publications – Reach out at 03335293238/ ishtiaqrao@gmail.com/ X: ishtiaqrao
